citation.article-title: Taxonomic and phylogenetic studies on a new taxon of budding, hyphal Proteobacteria, Hirschia baltica gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Hirschia (Hirsch'i.a. M.L. fem. n. Hirschia, honoring Peter Hirsch, a German microbiologist who is an expert on budding and hyphal bacteria)
Gram-negative, nonsporeforming, prosthecate bacteria with one or occasionally two polarly inserted hyphae.
Reproduction occurs by bud formation at the tips of the hyphae.
The buds are polarly monotrichously flagellated.
C1 compounds are not utilized as carbon sources.
The ubiquinone system is a Q10 system.
Hydroxyfatty acids are of the 3-OH type. 23s rRNA is not nicked.
The DNA base ratio of the single species, Hirschia baltica, is 45 to 47 mol% G+C.

The genus Hirschia is a member of the alpha subclass of Proteobacteria and is distinctly but remotely related to members of the genera Hyphomicrobium, Filomicrobium, Pedomicrobium, and Dichotomicrobium.
The type species is Hirschia baltica.S
